com.analog.lyric.dimple.events

Class EventSourceIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.collect.UnmodifiableIterator<T>
      • com.analog.lyric.collect.UnmodifiableReleasableIterator<IDimpleEventSource>
        • com.analog.lyric.dimple.events.EventSourceIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReleasableIterator<IDimpleEventSource>, java.util.Iterator<IDimpleEventSource>

    @NotThreadSafe
public class EventSourceIterator
extends UnmodifiableReleasableIterator<IDimpleEventSource>
    Iterates over Dimple event sources, which are also Dimple option holders.

    This provides the iterator returned by both the DimpleOptionHolder.getOptionDelegates and DimpleEventListener.eventSources methods. It is used for both option lookup and event dispatching.

    The iterator visits objects starting from an initial source using the following recursive ordering:

    1. Visit source
    2. Visit source's corresponding model event source if not null and not the same as the source itself. For instance, if source were a Dimple solver variable, this step would visit the corresponding model variable.
    3. If the source has a non-null parent, then recursively visit's sources starting with the parent.
    4. Otherwise, if the source has no parent, but visited a model source in step 2 with a non-null parent, then the algorithm will recursively visit sources from the model's parent.
    Or written in pseudocode: 
     void visitSources(IDimpleEventSource source)
 {
     visit(source);
 
     IDimpleEventSource modelSource = source.getModelEventSource();
     boolean hasModel = modelSource != null && modelSource != source;
     if (hasModel)
         visit(modelSource);
 
     IDimpleEventSource parent = source.getEventParent();
     if (parent == null && hasModel)
         parent = model.getEventParent();
 
     if (parent != null)
     {
         visitSources(parent);
     }
 }

    Since:
    0.07

        public void release()
        Description copied from interface: ReleasableIterator
        Release this iterator so that it can be reused instead of being garbage-collected. The caller must not invoke any other methods on this object after releasing it.

      • reset

        Parameters:
